input_text:
Job Title: Head of Partnerships

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Sales, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Head of Partnerships
Reports to: Chief Strategy Officer
Remote U.S. (designated states)This position is fully remote and may be performed from one of the following U.S. states: AL, AZ, FL, GA, IN, KS, MA, MI, MS, NC, NV, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA.

The Head of Partnerships is a member of the strategy team who is responsible for managing all partnership aspects of Raintree.
Duties and ResponsibilitiesBuild an effective vendor and partnerships strategy and execute against it, including segmentation and assessment of existing partners.Serves as a leader responsible for building pipeline, sourcing, negotiating, executing, and maintaining unique, impactful partnership opportunities to achieve the organization's short and long-range goals. Working with internal stakeholders, they will ensure that strategies and deals represent the best interest within Raintree.Work with the Product team to build market deep dives, understand customer needs, and identify key market opportunities. Lead in sourcing the appropriate partnerships to drive value for our clients.Work with Finance and Product to build economic models to determine favorable and long-term pricing strategies. Utilize past partnership experience in identifying ideal types of partnerships and deal structures (e.g. white label, reseller, revenue share, etc).Work with key stakeholders to create and negotiate contracts. Create and maturate our partnership program and processes, from beginning through to partnership management.Be the point of contact for Raintree partnerships and be able to ensure they are meeting SLAs, operational and client engagement expectations, roadmap commitments, and quality of service. Identify and cultivate relationships with key partners, ensuring alignment with the company's commitment to improving outcomes and ensuring that our goals are aligned and measured.Build departmental budgets and manage towards budgets and company targets.Work with partners to secure commitments for Raintree’s user conference exhibitors.
Position Proficiencies and RequirementsBachelor’s degree from an accredited college or universityFive or more years of experience in enterprise software focused on partnership management, contract creation and negotiation, and value-creationExperience driving value-creation through partnerships to meet business goals in a technology environment highly desiredHealthcare experience preferredBudgeting experience highly preferredDemonstrated ability to establish priorities and achieve results through a cross functional team
Competencies to Drive SuccessLeadership: Provide focus and motivational support to achieve excellence in client satisfaction; Foster teamwork and cooperation for team unity; Manage individual and team’s performanceCommunication: Effective and concise written communication target to specific audiences; Strong verbal communication and listening skills to assure understanding and consultation across multiple stakeholdersAnalytical Thinking: Approaches problems logically; Provides meaningful analyses through verbal and written presentationsOrganizational Skills and Concern for Order: Keeps accurate records; Provides meaningful data for reviewInitiative: Engaged and proactive; Takes appropriate action with minimal oversightAgility and Time Management: Able to respond to changing priorities, demands, procedures and technology; Excellent organizational and time management skills to meet client needsPassion: Excitement and energy for the deal while maintaining ethical standards and integrity
Our Core ValuesWe put our Clients First - We are Open and Honest - We are Disciplined, Yet FlexibleWe love to Solve Problems - We are Committed to Greatness - We are One Passionate Family
About UsWork with a World-Class Healthcare Team. Raintree Systems is the leading provider of both efficiency tools and engagement features that are built to manage ALL aspects of the healthcare industry. By way of high-level automation, intuitive analytics and simplified reporting, our platform eases practice staff's workload and optimizes business operations. Our team of Rainees is built on expertise in their respective areas with a core understanding of teamwork and collaboration. Plus, our Rainees have an enthusiasm for excellence, growth, and continuous improvement in our process and the ways in which we support our valued clients. If you align with our company values and seek to join a team of friendly and passionate people who are dedicated to excellence, Raintree may be the perfect fit for you!
Our PerksRemote Work/Work From HomePaid Time Off/11 Paid Holidays/Year-End Holiday BreakHealth, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA401K with Company MatchDisability & Life InsuranceEmployee Assistance ProgramPaid Parental Leave
Raintree Systems provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
